intro: Cynometra phaselocarpa, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The tree produces oval, woody fruits that contain a nutritious seed kernel, which is the source of shea butter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its economic and ecological importance, it is a valuable species in both traditional and commercial contexts.
